name: Raydond Han de Arrise Saint-Cond Jeap Vineyard Pinot Noir 2017
description: This is an easy drinking wine that will pair well with a wide variety of foods including grilled salmon, pork roast, roast chicken and cheeses. This wine is a good match for Asian dishes, Asian-inspired pasta dishes with Asian sauces, Asian foods with ginger, black pepper, and spices, as well as dishes with roasted vegetables and vegetables that are vegetarian or with vegetables cooked with mushrooms and tomatoes, and red meat and grilled vegetables.

name: Franciens Quistagelli Le Bronella Ila 2017
description: Bold, full-bodied and elegant with firm but supple tannins. The color is deep ruby with violet tones. A very well-rounded and intense bouquet. Intense bouquet with good acidity and great balance between fruit and tannins. Le Bronella Ila is a very well-balanced wine with good freshness. A very versatile wine with a good ageing potential.

name: Donentai d'Allessa Chianti Clansis Barbarino (1.5 Liter Mabbe) 2000
description: This wine is a superb value, offering up flavors of cherries, berries, spices, mint and a hint of minerals.  A soft, round, medium-bodied, velvety wine with a velvety finish.

name: Santura Reserve Sauvignon Blanc 2016

name: Baron Marias Vigno Burmaltono Risernha Tava Zinfardel 1998

name: Siwootiras Coasti Selock Siypesi Magnumi Syrah 2010
description: Deep ruby in color with intense aromas of black cherries, strawberries and spices. Medium bodied with well-balanced acidity, sweet tannins, and a long finish. Serve well-chilled.      wine.  Enjoy this wine as an appetizer or with a wide variety of foods.

The mouth feel is soft, round and juicy with a good structure. The finish is lingering and soft with vanilla and toast. This wine can be enjoyed now and for the next 3-5 years.

name: Zalbach Or Red Rosse 2017

name: Fedor Farmily Rose Riselakt Cabernet Sauvignon 2013

This wine is well-balanced with a good mouthfeel. It is an excellent food companion and can be paired with grilled foods, pasta dishes with tomatoes and rich cream sauces, light poultry dishes and grilled fish. Serve slightly chilled.

name: Pos Creek Pinot Noir 2003

The mouthfeel is soft and soft, yet with excellent mouth-coating viscosity. The wine is medium-bodied, with supple, supple tannins that give good balance and length. The finish is long and pleasant, with lingering flavors of ripe fruit. The mouthfeel is a perfect accompaniment to grilled fish, poultry, or pasta dishes with light sauces.

name: Molbent Vineyards Winerre Hosu Pinot Noir Riserva (375ML half-bottle) 2010

On the palate, the wine is juicy and well-balanced with ripe flavors of raspberry, cherry, and strawberry, complemented by a touch of mineral and oak. The wine has excellent depth of flavor with flavors of red fruit, earth, spice, and sweet oak.

name: Watph Drensca Cabernet Sharlos Blend 2002

The blend is comprised of 90% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Merlot, 10%orative blend of the Cabernets and Merlots, and 5% Cabern signing the blend is made with 5% Cabernet Franc. The wine is aged for 5 months in oak barrels and is bottled without fining or filtration. The blend is very typical of the region of Chile, where it is produced. The wine is very deep in color with red highlights, and displays aromas of ripe fruit and spices. The mouthfeel is rich, round and well-rounded, with round tannins. The finish is long and pleasing.

name: Pprards Cabernet Sauvignon 1995

The finish is long and sweet, with lingering sweet, toasty oak. The wine will improve over the next 2- 3 years and continue to improve over the next 3 to 4 years.

This is a dry, crisp and fruity wine with a distinct mineral character, typical of the Awatere River. It is well-balanced in style, with freshness and fresh acidity and a lingering finish.

name: Elial Leborgna Rowe Winery Red Block de Canegneis 1998
description: auras of spices, balsamic and sweet-ripe black cherries, with some mineral tones.  The flavors mirror aromas with black cherries and blackberries dominating with sweet-ripe, toasty oak, hints of vanilla, chocolate, and toast.

name: Chateau Marie Rose 2017
description: Chateau Marie Rosé has a brilliant pale pink color and a hint of salmon. The aroma is a blend of fresh raspberries and strawberries with a hint of floral tones. The palate is refreshing, medium bodied and well-balanced with fresh acidity, medium sweetness, medium alcohol, and a long dry, persistent finish.

name: Gamas Moascoal Herdan Barbeta 2014
description: Rich garnet red with orange reflections. Intense nose, marked by aromas of ripe fruits, cherries, strawberries, cherries, redcurrants and plums, with subtle hints of spices, violet and violet flowers. It is a well-rounded wine, with well-integrated tannins, balanced acidity, freshness and a pleasant finish.

name: Olti Goarci 2016
description: The name Goyette, meaning “little boy”, refers to the boy who first introduced Olti to the Collio Goriziano vineyards in the 18th century. The name is derived from the Latin word for “little boy”, glistening in the sun, and was chosen to honor the boy’s affinity for eating the grapes with his father.

name: Triocanina Bulalcalinal Carnato 1998
description: The wine has an intense ruby red color with intense, spicy and fruity aromas, which harmonize well with the subtle sweetness of the tannins.  On the palate, the wine is well-balanced with a good balance between acidity and sweetness.  The aftertaste is long and pleasant with notes of fruit, mineral, tobacco, leather and vanilla.

name: Villamey Eller Granti Pasasitent Pinot Noir 2015
description: 254 cases produced.  Aromas of cherry, strawberry, and vanilla are followed by flavors of red fruits, cherries, and raspberries.  The mouth Guests with medium tannins that lead to a well-balanced and resurrecting finish.  A versatile food companion.  A perfect match for cheeses, salmon, duck, red meats, and other dishes.

name: Ravocucello Chiant Chardonnay 1999
description: The wine has a very attractive straw color with greenish tints.  The nose offers aromas of pear, apple, and tropical fruit with a touch of toastiness.  The mouthfeel is medium-bodied with Identification of the typical varietal characteristics of Chianti, with medium-high acidity.  The mouthfeel is medium-long and fresh with pleasant flavors of fruit and fresh fruit.  The finish is soft, round, and refreshing with long, well-balanced acidity.  It is a well-balanced wine, perfect for food matching and enjoyment with food.  It is an excellent companion to seafood, shellfish in cream sauce, poultry, veal, and cream based pasta dishes.

name: Iromero Familuurs Chardonnay 2000
description: The fruit is grown in the Casablanca Valley of Chile. The grapes are selected from vineyards located in the Casablanca Valley. The wine is fermented in French oak barrels for 8 months and aged on the lees for a minimum of 1 year before bottling.    The result is a crisp, refreshing wine with flavors of tropical fruit and peach.   The wine is a good companion to grilled fish, shellfish, fowl, and pasta dishes with white sauces.

name: Bodegas Ondro d'Arladi Riserva 1997
description: The wine is full of berry and spicy tablas flavors straightforwardly on the674.  It is an excellent value, and is meant to drink now or cellar for two to three years.  The wine refuger is located in the village of Castiglione Falletto.  It is a perfect complement for Mediterranean dishes, particularly roasted vegetables, veal and roasted peppers.

name: Lunta Felielo 2000
description: The color is pale yellow with greenish hues.  The bouquet is delicate, floral, with notes of lime, apple and fruit, reminiscent of peaches, apricots, bananas, pear and peach.  The taste is well-balanced, fruity, pleasant, and soft.  The mouthfeel is fresh, fresh, fruity and pleasantly tannic.  It is well-balanced, well-rounded and well-balanced.  The aftertaste is long and pleasant, full of character and of freshness.

name: Chateau Pe Dravin Pous Sait Bowes Terre Caryvion Silo D. Domaine Lanciens Pea Hombettave Pinot Noir 2008
description: The 2008 Pous Sait Bowes is medium garnet in color. The nose offers aromas of red fruit, strawberries and cherries with aromas of earth and spice. The mouthfeel is soft and generous with ripe flavors of red and black cherries, strawberries and strawberries and raspberries. The finish is long with a good acidity. The tannins are present but fine and well-integrated. This wine will cellar well for up to two years and will pair well with grilled fish, particularly Northwest Salmon, especially Northwest Salmon in cream sauce and veal dishes Paleo.

name: Jestupumonas Rieslina 2016
description: This wine is a wine with intense aromas of citrus and fruit with hints of citrus. The palate is full and round with flavors of lemon and grapefruit. The wine has a crisp and refreshing taste, which is balanced by a clean, clean acidity. The Riesling is a great match for a wide range of dishes, especially those with citrus, fruits and cream sauces.

name: Marzalmicks Courest Asparko Cabernet Sauvignon 20004
description: This wine is deep garnet in color with violet tones.  Aromas include ripe cherries, currants, and spices with a touch of pepper.  The mouthfeel is medium to full-bodied with rich, round tannins, good acidity, and long finish.  The wine is best consumed with grilled red and white meats, particularly those grilled in red wine sauces.

name: Zolfour Dello Vy Vineyard Chard-Tlondoda Vietton Brute 2006
description: Vibrant aromas of blackberries, cherries, and vanilla. Flavors mirror aromas with vanilla, sweet spices, vanilla, and toast. The mouth feel is full bodied with firm yet supple tannins and very balanced acidity. The finish is long with lingering fruit and spice.

name: Chateau Moutantierie St. Jean Sanonett Premier Cru Comazei Valley CAm. Toncane Cabernet Sauvignon 2000
description: Comazei Valley is located in the Casablanca Valley of Chile. This wine is an excellent match for grilled, roasted and grilled fish.

name: Kentoma Frensapo Pinot Grigio 2000
description: Fruit aromas are very distinctive, with aromas of pear, citrus and honeysuckle. The flavor is of fresh, crisp, and slightly sweet, with ripe, juicy fruit flavors. The mouthfeel is round and soft, with well-integrated oak tones on the finish.   The wine shows excellent balance between the acidity and sweetness, with a long, pleasing finish.   The wine is very enjoyable now, and will cellar well for 2- 3 years.  This wine can be paired with grilled fish, especially Northwest Salmon, poultry, shellfish in cream sauce, salads, light pasta dishes and cream based sauces.

name: Mungia Estate Hice Ridge Reekers Valley Pinot Noir 2006
description: Aromas of black cherries, spices and vanilla, with a hint of oak and fresh earthiness. Flavors mirror aromas with flavors of cherry, vanilla, and spice, with a touch of mineral. The mouthfeel is soft and silky, with soft, round tannins. The finish is long and lingering with soft, lingering acidity.

name: BolRerda Fosota Blanctionia Anco Brigno dela 2003
description: Ancós was first produced in 1996, and is the flagship wine of Spain's renowned AOC “Fosota” wine region.  Bolerda Fosota, meaning ‘Greatness, Range, Range’, is a blend of 60% Garnacha, 40% Syrah, 10% Cariñena, 10% Mourvedre, 10% Cinsault and 10% Counoise.  This is an attractive, well-rounded, easy-drinking wine with fresh fruit flavors and aromas.    The name means “a place where you can drink wine,” which is the perfect combination for a good meal.

name: Woing Brilo Montagno Spatella 2010
description: Spatella is an unusual white wine that is produced from a blend of three different grape varieties.  It is the most structured wine of the appellation.  The vineyards are located in the Tre Vigne area and the Neive area.  The grapes for Spatella are harvested early in the season when the sugar level is at the optimum level.  The grapes are then kept on the skins for 3 to 4 weeks before pressing.  The wine is then aged in wood barrels for 4 months before being bottled.   Aged for 6 months in steel and in stainless steel tanks before being pressed.   It is an extremely versatile wine that can be paired with a wide range of foods, especially lighter meals, fish, shellfish, pasta, grilled vegetables, pasta sauces, white meats, vegetable soups and Asian dishes.

name: Forboldi Sele Cabernet Sauvignon 2009
description: Vibrant ruby red color with intense aromas of red fruit, black cherry, and spices. Full-bodied, rich and complex on the palate, with ripe tannins, good acidity and well-balanced acidity. Long and pleasant finish.

name: Perasel Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
description: The 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon is ruby in color with aromas of blackberry, plum and cassis with hints of cocoa and roasted coffee. The mouthfeel is soft and round with round flavors of blackberry, dark chocolate, and sweet toasted oak. The flavors mirror aromas with flavors of ripe cherry and red currants with a touch of black pepper. irrelevant.

name: Williana Cellar Vineyard Zinfandel 2016
description: The 2016 Williana Vineyard Zinfandel is a very aromatic wine with black cherry and currant fruit flavors, with notes of chocolate and earthiness. The mouthfeel is round and rich, with great volume and good weight on the mid-palate and long finish.  with

name: Kim Heiighoton Pinot Noir 2016
description: The Heiighoton Vineyard is located in the Yamhill-Carlton AVA, just popularity-stacked with a few hundred hundred thousand vines, the oldest dating back to 2002. The wine is a classic, complex and well-balanced Pinot Noir with aromas of ripe cherry, blueberry and spice. The mouthfeel is soft and supple, with round, round and round tannins that round out theextensive finish. The wine is ready to drink now and will cellar well for up to five years.

name: Sea'Picact Clantingle Merlot 1997
description: Aged for 9 months in French oak, this wine has a garnumniati hue.  The aromas are full of ripe, round, juicy fruit with hints of vanilla, toast, and sweet toast.  The mouthfeel is soft, round, and well-rounded with soft, round, and well-integrated tannins.  The finish is long and fruity.  The wine is an excellent companion for Mediterranean foods, particularly grilled and lightly smoked.

name: Goules Baron Pinot Noir 2009
description: This is a classic example of the Willamette Valley.  Its color is medium garnet and is very pretty, with attractive orange hues.  Aromas are classic Oregon.  This wine shows aromas of cherry, strawberry, black tea, tea leaves and earthy minerals.  On the palate, it has soft and sweet flavors of raspberry and raspberry compote.  The mouthfeel is medium bodied, with medium acidity and good structure.  Flavors mirror aromas with bright acidity and well balanced tannins.  It has good length on the finish.  The wine is an excellent companion for grilled fish, especially Northwest Salmon, poultry and roasted vegetables.  This wine can be paired with grilled fish, poultry, roasted vegetables and Asian dishes.

name: Galbiablesta Valley Bruchet Blend 2013
description: Deep ruby red color with violet hues.  The nose offers very ripe red and black fruits with good intensity and finesse.  On the palate, it is full-bodied, rich and fruity with ripe, round tannins and a long, fresh finish.   It is a wine to be served with hearty foods such as pasta with meat sauces, roasted vegetables, roasted meats, pied-de-cuisine, and cheese.  It is also excellent with grilled meats, hearty dishes, game, and mild cheeses.

name: Hiay Rifgnon Jas Riesling 2013
description: This Riesling is perfect for sipping on its Callsign, or with a variety of seafood such as lobster, crab, crab-shells, scallops, and crabmeat.   with cream soups, fowl, salads, and seafood dishes with green sauces.

name: Heflents Bewungevaix Vino Syrah 2000
description: The bouquet is very intense with dried fruit characters, mainly plums, cherries, blackberries, licorormal and spice. The palate is rich and spicy with subtle, well-integrated oak. The wine is well-balanced with soft, sweet tannins, a rich mouth feel and good acidity.

name: Bayter Syrah Cabernet Sauvignon 2001
description: Nose: Aromas are intense with ripe, sweet, sweet and spicy aromas.  The aromas are very attractive and fresh with fresh ripe and dried fruit flavours with subtle earthy undertones.  The palate is rich and soft with ripe, sweet, ripe and sweet tannins that are well-integrated and well-balanced.  The finish is long, spicy, long and fresh.

name: Marzheeman Ton S3 Filis Inice & Cabinet Sanamit 1999
description: Tina Maria, a specialist in winegrowing in Chile, started to create a wine of great complexity.  The color is a vibrant yellow with golden hues.  The nose is fresh and fruity with hints of citrus fruit.  The mouthfeel is full and smooth with refreshing acidity.  The aftertaste is fresh and persistent with pleasant mineral tones.  This wine is well-suited to a wide variety of foods including pasta, poultry, white meats, white fish, light salads, shellfish, creamy sauces, and fresh cheeses.

name: Lise Saint Giajrages Lorey-Pongigen Vhite 2014
description: From vineyards that are located in Vastel and Merel, the Lorey-Pongigen Vhite is a pale yellow wine with greenish tones. The nose is very fresh with a hint of mineral and salty aromas. The palate is very fresh with fruit, lemon and grapefruit flavors. A fresh, balanced wine with a long, juicy finish.

name: Steeser Joufford Family Cabernet Sauvignon 1996
description: In the glass the 1996 Cabernet Sauvignon is a deep, intense garnet. The aromas show intense aromas of blackberries, currants and cherries, with spicy overtones of nutmeg, leather, earth and toast. The flavors mirror aromas with complex layers of blackberries, currants, cherries and sweet oak. The mouth feel is soft, round, and very well balanced. The mouthfeel is medium-bodied with round, rich, ripe tannins, yet with a lively, refreshing acidity that provides an overall impression of freshness. The finish is long, smooth and well-rounded. The fruit intensity is confirmed in the mouth feel and fruit flavors are supported by supple, well-integrated oak, which lends to the overall impression of richness and structure. The finish is long and full of flavor with lingering mineral overtones. The wine will cellar well for up to five years, and will continue to improve for the next four to five years. The 1996 vintage was exceptional, and the 1996 vintage of this wine is exceptional. The wine will continue to improve for at cellar temperature for the next 5 to 7 years.

name: Breker Veltwullil Halbelt Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
description: The 2014 vintage of ‘Hal belt’ is an elegant wine with rich aromas and flavors of cassis, blackberry, and black pepper. The wine is soft, supple, and well-balanced with good length and a pleasant finish. Enjoy with steak, rack of lamb, or pasta with rich sauces.

name: Bron Colrera Classico Caskino Tarre 2001
description: Complex, with complex, intense aromas, with well-integrated notes of sweet blackberries and violets, complemented by spices, leather and a hint of vanilla. The taste is generous, warm, and pleasant with well-balanced acidity. The tannins are soft, velvety and round.

name: God. Miquos Promoto Rose 2015
description: Aromas of red fruits and floral aromas. Fresh flavors of red and black cherries with flavors of strawberries and red berries. Bright acidity with a smooth and fruity finish. Serve well chilled.  mineral notes, freshness and aromas of red fruit and a hint of grapefruit.

name: AntaLo Soci San Saivero Sangettica Riesling 2000
description: A fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity, fruity bragging, boasting, boasting, boasting, boasting, boasting, boasting, boasting, boasting, boasting, boasting, boasting, boasting, boasting, boasting, allergies, allergies, hypersensitivity, hypersensitivity, hypersensitivity, hypersensitivity, hypersensitivity, hypersensitivity, sensitivity, hypersensitivity, sensitivity, sensitivities, sensitivities, sensitivity, Sensituation, Sensituation, Sensituation, Sensituation, Sensituation, Sensituation, Sensituation, Sensituation, Sensituation, Sensituation, Sensituation, Sensit

name: Clos da Crest Vineyards Winery Bruberg' Arilalder Vineyard Chardonnay 2012
description: The 2012 vintage gave us fruit with intense aromas of green apple, citrus, and mineral. The wine is medium-bodied with flavors of pineapple, citrus, and spice, balanced by bright acidity and creamy mouthfeel. The mouthfeel is mouth-coating, with rich, viscous flavors of peach, grapefruit, and mango, balanced by a crisp acidity. The finish is long and lingering with a touch of sweetness.

name: Gessoof Pinot Noir 1999
description: The color is medium ruby in color with intense cherry, strawberry, plum and spice aromas. The mouth feel is full and rich with flavors of cherry, spice, vanilla and toast. The mouthfeel is round and soft, with well-balanced acidity and well-integrated tannins. The finish is long, lingering on the palate and giving a touch of spice. The mouth feel is medium to full bodied with good acidity, acidity and a lingering, sweet aftertaste.  Serve well-chilled.   The wine will continue to improve for the next 2- 3 years.  This vintage will pair well with grilled fish, especially Northwest Salmon and poultry dishes with grilled vegetables and mild cheese.

name: Do Mata & Soloma Malisyin-Malbec 2000
description: Malisyin-Malbec is a lively wine, with violet-colored tones.  The nose offers fresh, fruity aromas with attractive notes of blackberry and raspberry, with a touch of earthiness.  The mouthfeel is soft and round, with excellent volume and length.  It has a good acidity that adds to the freshness of the wine.

name: Figrianett Ovesio 6 Bellari Bentemle Gima Brunenliose 2014
description: The name 6 Bellari means six grapes, as the grapes are produced from 6 different vineyards.  The wine is produced in the same way as the Brunello, with a new fermentation and malo-lactic in steel tanks.  The result is a wine with a deep ruby red color with violet highlights.  The aromas are intense and intense, with notes of blackberries and cherries.  The flavor is very pleasant, with soft tannins that are well balanced with acidity.  The finish is long and pleasant.  Pairings:  Serve well chilled.  A good match for meat dishes, game and cheese.  Serve at room temperature.

name: Chateau Baly Rogen (3 Liter Barton-& Horce Cotcros 2016
origin: Nap slippery, red fruit, blackberry, and licorice with some mineral and spice notes. On the palate, it is full-bodied, with great acidity and texture, very well expanding in the mouth, and finishing with a nice length.   and

name: B.E. Fam Sevileyhirges Hourts Vineyard Chardonnay 2001
description: The wine is a pale straw color. The aromas are lively with fresh pear, green apple and ripe peach. The mouthfeel is round and rounder with a sweet, spicy finish. The wine is drinkable now and will cellar well for up to 5 years.

name: Domaine Mais Sauvillamiele Luusser 2012
description: This wine is a crisp and refreshing wine with a fresh acidity and mineral character. The wine is bright with fresh, lifted aromas of fresh green capsicum, lees, and fresh herbs. The palate is medium bodied, medium weight, well-balanced and has excellent depth and length.

name: Chateau de Chemannes-Mountonet 2012
description: The 2012 Chateau de Chemannes-Mountonet is an elegant wine with rich aromas of blackberry, plum and spice. Flavors mirror aromas with ripe cherry, blue SSL, toasty oak, and vanilla from barrel aging. The mouthfeel is soft and velvety betrayal the aromas with well-balanced acidity and silky tannins. The wine finishes with rich, long-lasting vainilla flavors.

name: Sifoch Perre Chardonnay 1999
description: Complex, rich, and round, with an attractive straw-yellow hue.  Bright aromas of ripe pear, apple, and melon with a touch of oak and toast.  The mouthfeel is medium-bodied, with balanced acidity and crisp acidity.  The finish is long with lingering flavors of pear and apple.

name: Reylin Carello Cabernet Sauvignon 2012
description: The Reylin Carello Cabernet Sauvignon is a deep ruby red wine with intense aromas of ripe red fruits, cherries, and blackberries, and a hint of anise and tobacco. The flavors mirror aromas with a touch of spice, mineral, coffee andellectual toastiness. The tannins are balanced with acidity, which leads to a long finish with good length.

name: La Riceyard Terralco Alts Siliko Santa Bounova Casa Rezone 2012
description: Aromas of cherry, dried cranberries, blackberries, and floral notes. The flavors mirror aromas with juicy cherry, licorice, cinnamon, and black pepper, followed by a round mouthfeel with soft, sweet tannins and good length.

name: Argiana Gornen Santa Valley Povinier Isena Wellaitna Tiso 2011
origin: Santa Ynez Valley, Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California
description: The 2011 Santa Ynez Valley Povinier Isena Wellaitna Tiso is a blend of 95% Grenache, 10% Syrah, 5% Counoise and 4% Mourvedre. It has aromas of cherry, strawberry, spice and anise. It is soft and well trialed on the palate, with flavors of cherry, strawberry, blackberry and a touch of toastiness. The tannins are well balanced, adding to the complexity of the wine. The finish is very long, with ripe fruit and spice with some acidity.

name: Arnobofd Cabernet Sauvignon 2006
description: The 2006 Arnobofd Cabernet Sauvignon has rich aromas of blackcurrant, raspberry and licorice with a touch of chocolate. The mouthfeel is full-bodied and structured, with well-integrated tannins and lingering fruit flavors. The finish is long and balanced, with fresh acidity and sweet oak. This wine will cellar well for the next 3- 5 years.

name: Carp Blanc Camenne Vineyard Pinot Noir 2014
description: The 2014 vintage was a warm and warm growing season with plenty of heat in the early days of the growing season. A cool growing season with moderate temperatures, and warm temperatures throughout the day allowed for even ripening, and good sugar and acid balance. The wine is very approachable now, and will cellar well for at least two years.

name: La Worthan Vineyards Chardonnay 2014
description: The wine opens with aromas of white peach, lychee, citrus blossom, lemon zest, honeysuckle, and vanilla. On the palate, bright acidity and flavors of grapefruit and kiwi fruit are followed by a mouthwatering finish of mineral and lingering flavors of toasted hazelnuts.

name: Clamon Aubcermaich Estol Unksz Merlot 2014
description: Pair with smoked fish, chicken, veal, pasta dishes with meat sauces, pork roast, veal tenderloin and roasted vegetables. .   steak with mushrooms, game birds, veal roast, veal and veal sauce, and chicken curry.

name: Alaykae Noiret Riesling 1997
description: The grapes for this wine come from vineyards situated in the Cape's premier vineyards.  The grapes are harvested by hand and the whole berries are vinified at the winery in the traditional manner.  The resulting wine is dry, with crisp acidity and a medium body.  The grapes are sourced from four vineyards located in the Southern Cape - the Cape's premier wine regions.  The grapes were grown in the Cape's South Island regions.  The vineyards are located at the highest points on the eastern slopes of the Cape Mountains.  These regions are known for the unique microclimates that reflect the influence of the Pacific Ocean in the region's cool winds.  The Cape's Riesling Ivyatex is an easy-drinking style wine, which is well-suited to a wide range of foods, particularly seafood and light salads.  It is also a great Kirsten dessert wine.

name: Georlon Sebert St. Cantain Asterit 2016
description: Aromas of ripe cherries, cola, and spice. Rich and mouth filling, this medium-bodied wine is dominated by flavors of cherry, cranberry, and a hint of earthiness. The wine finishes with round, soft tannins.

name: Woles Lameos Riesling 1998
description: This medium-bodied, dry wine is a perfect match for grilled fish, shellfish, shellfish sauces, pasta dishes, veal and poultry dishes with cream sauces, fresh fruit salad, creamy sauces, creamy sauces, creamy sauces with fruit sauces, spicy foods and Asian foods.  Serve slightly chilled at 45 degrees F.

name: Chateau Paufaley Merlot 2000
description: Our 1999 Central Coast Merlot has aromas of ripe cherry, blackberry and toasted oak.  On the palate, the wine is soft and round with flavors of cherry and plum, with toasty oak notes.  This wine is well-balanced with a long finish.  The wine is delicious with roasted poultry, grilled vegetables, veal chops and cheeses.  Serve well chilled at a temperature of 8-10°C.

name: Doutye Chenrit Le  Pinot Noir 2013
description: This wine shows lovely aromas of sweet red fruits, such as cherry, plum and cranberry, with flavors of blackberries, blueberries, blueberries and sweet spices, vanilla and toast. The mouthfeel is round and rich, with bright acidity that is well balanced with round and ripe tannins. The finish is long with ripe and soft, well-balanced acidity.

name: Quintanert Jataihy Chaannai Saleser Cru 2001
description: The name of the wine is the translation of the ancient 'Jataihy' or 'beautiful' fish.  The grape variety is a blend of two varieties that are very much in the style of the classical Nivensha wines, and the name of the wine is very similar.  The grapes are grown in the area of the famous Japanese Sea, where the weather is cooled by the Pacific Ocean and the temperature is moderate.  The grapes are grown in shallow, volcanic soils with low fertility levels.  The grapes are harvested during the cool of night in order to preserve the fresh, natural acidity.  The wine is then fermented in stainless steel and then aged in oak.  The result is a rich and intense wine with a beautiful purple hue.

name: Chateau et Clos Pupith Gryer-Vieir-Slatiser Vanley Ch 2016
description: Château & Clos Pupith Château & Clos is an elegant and elegant wine with aromas of vanilla, brown sugar and blackberry, followed by flavors of cherry and dried plum. On the palate, the wine is full-bodied with good weight and a long, smooth finish. The tannins are very well-integrated and well-integrated in the mouth, yet are still very well-integrated, making this wine a good candidate for cellaring. The mouthfeel is medium-bodied with a good acidity, making it well-balanced and approachable. The wine is very well-balanced and drinkable now, and will cellar well for the next 3 to 5 years.

name: Runtan Lanke/Chamri Vigna Lunte 2003
description: Vibrant ruby color with violet tones. The nose offers attractive floral aromas of violet and strawberry with light touch of violets. The mouthfeel is generous and smooth with good tannins. The wine is well-balanced and shows excellent intensity with a long and pleasant finish. The wine is an excellent companion for grilled vegetables, poultry, veal, and mild cheeses.

name: Ustollapino Altoadmoritiakio Castello Chianti 1997
description: Vineyards: Castello di Ustollapino, Uplandia.  Purity: 100% Sangiovese.  Harvest: September.  Aging potential: 2-3 years.  Serving Suggestions: Ideal with grilled fish, poultry and light pasta dishes.

name: Macquesuco Chianti da Roba Rossa 2015
description: Rich ruby red in color, this wine has a well-balanced acidity. On the palate it is fruity, fresh, with sweet tannins, 1870ml in the glass. The wine has an excellent structure, fruity, very well-balanced acidity and a long, pleasant finish. It is an easy-drinking wine, perfect with grilled, roasted and game birds.

name: VAlrail Calery Cruc Cabernet Sauvignon 2000
description: Our 2000 Calery Cruc Cabernet Sauvignon is a deep ruby color with aromas of ripe fruit and cedar.  The mouthfeel is soft and round with flavors of red fruit and cherry, accompanied by well-integrated oak tones.  The wine is rich and velvety, with a long finish and round, sweet tannins.

name: Selborato Reserve Chardonnay 2014
description: Yellow straw with greenish tinges.  Aromas of apple, pear, pineapple and vanilla.  The mouth is full, with good volume and fresh acidity.  The flavor is of ripe pear, vanilla, almond, toasted almond, almond butter, butter cream and a hint of oak.

name: Wessista Ede Conn Mougrane Dossichi Villay Rose 2015
description: This is a light, refreshing, fresh and refreshing Rosé that shows good color and aromas. It has fruity and refreshing flavors, with floral aromas and flavors of raspberry.  It is light-bodied, with balanced acidity, alcohol, and sugar. It is a dry wine, well-balanced, and pleasant.

name: Conita de licery Tout Chateauu-Cowianty Ciraminneles's 2017
description: The 2017 Ciraminneles’ Pinot Noir is a lively and elegant wine. The nose is very clean with delicate aromas of fresh cherries, strawberries, raspberries and cherries with subtle notes of cinnamon, vanilla, violet and spice. On the palate it is fresh and fruity with good acidity. The finish is long and fresh.

name: Domaine Ferraide Coceste Rires-Viet Cabernet 2000
description: Viet is a wine for intense, but not overly fruity wines. It is best paired with roasted meats, vegetables, poultry, and cheeses.  aromas of black fruit, cedar and spicy oak.  Flavors mirror aromas with slight toasty oak and spices.  It is well-balanced with good acidity and soft, round tannins.  The finish is long with the right balance between acidity and alcohol.  It is best served with a medium-bodied meal of roasted or grilled meat dishes, poultry and rich pasta dishes.

name: Lorramiastot Chateaufeun-20091
description: Chateaufeun is a pale yellow-gold color. The nose offers delicate floral aromas, hints of citrus, and a slight mineral element. The mouthfeel is well-balanced, smooth, and well-structured with an agreeable acidity. The finish is fresh and refreshing, showing great freshness.

name: Chateau Fallet Ste. Mujrel 2016
description: Vibrant aromas of apple and tropical fruits. Vibrant flavors of green apple, pear, and mineral. Well-balanced with a crisp, refreshing finish. A perfect companion for shellfish, fresh cheese, or pasta in cream sauce..SUGGESTED FOOD PAIRINGS: Excellent as an aperitif.

name: Chateau Muit 2016
description: The 2016 Central Coast Chardonn Kissinger is an opulent wine with delicious aromas of dried fig Dud and black cherry, dark chocolate, and sweet oak. The palate is full and ripe with flavors of vanilla, cocoa powder, and roasted coffee, accented by sweet oak, spice, and fresh baked bread. It is smooth and well-rounded with round tannins. The wine is ready to drink now, and will cellar well for up to three years. Enjoy this 313-case wine now or cellar for up to five years.

name: AGuento Hion Pinot Noir 2015
description: The 2015 Hion Vineyards Pinot Noir is a very versatile wine that can be paired with food. This wine is a great companion to grilled fish and poultry dishes, but will also pair well with roasted vegetables, lighter sauces, pizza with light sauces, roasted vegetables, and grilled vegetables with a slightly sweet and ripe cheese sauce.

name: Scee tehanders Cabernet Sauvignon 2011
description: Scee tehanders Cabernet Sauvignon is an easy drinking wine, and it is ideal for all meals, particularly those dishes with tomato sauce, roasted vegetables and pasta dishes with rich sauces.  Serve at room temperature.  wine and food pairing:  Pair with grilled or grilled vegetables, veal, and game.

name: Heygpe Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2013
description: This is a beautiful wine with rich aromas of blackberries, cherries and blueberries with subtle notes of oak. The mouthfeel is lush with flavors of blackberries, black cherries, and sweet tobacco. The tannins are soft, sweet and well-integrated. This wine is rich, yet balanced with good acidity. The finish is long with lingering flavors of black fruits, vanilla, and spice. The 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon is ready to drink now, but will cellar well for up to five years.

name: Stard Pammier Vineyard Chardonnay
description: A rich, creamy mouthfeel with great balance between richness and freshness. Flavors of apple and pineapple with a hint of nutty, vanilla. The finish is rich with mouthwatering acidity and lingering flavors of white peach.  balance between freshness and body with a refreshing, long-lasting finish.

name: Kean-Pas Videlle Cabernet Sauvignon 2013
description: The 2013 Videlle Cabernet is a wine with great aromatics of blueberries, blackberries, and black cherries with hints of oak, leather, mineral, and spice. The flavors mirror aromas with concentrated flavors of blueberry, cassis, and blackberry, and dark chocolate. The wine is medium bodied with soft tannins that give it structure and balance. The finish is long with lingering flavors of toasted oak, black tea, and chocolate.

name: Fria Achine Ansate Winerrarg Pretite 2010
description: Intense straw color. The nose is complex, elegant and well-balanced. The nose opens with intense aromas of ripe fruits and floral aromas. In the mouth, the wine is soft, sweet and well-rounded. It has a refreshing acidity, good balance between sweetness and freshness.

name: Nilliamia Mitora Chardonnay 2001
description: Bright straw-yellow with greenish highlights. Clean, intense, floral, fruity nose with hints of apple, pear, banana, citrus, peach, and pineapple. Dry, full-bodied, warm, and pleasant, with round, round, well-balanced acidity. Intense and pleasant, this wine is well-balanced and persistent on the palate.

name: Kannans Estate Cabernet Sauvignon 2004
description: The wine has a dark ruby/purple colour. The nose is full of fresh blackcurrants and blackberries with hints of blackcurrant, black cherry, dried herbs and some toastiness. The palate is full of ripe fruit with generous flavours of dark cherries, blackcurrants and red berries with sweet, ripe tannins and a hint of pepper. The finish is long and lingering, with flavours of dark fruits and hints of toast.

name: St. Berworvern Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
description: Aromas of red and black cherries and blackberries with nuances of cocoa powder, vanilla and a touch of tobacco. Flavors mirror aromas with fresh cherry, blackberry, and cassis, with hints of chocolate and espresso. This wine is smooth, supple, and balanced with well-integrated tannins. It is a versatile food wine that will pair well with a wide range of foods including pasta, roasted vegetables, and grilled fish, particularly Northwest Salmon, roast lamb, veal, duck and roasted vegetables.

name: Hoodquit Stenong Dry Cabernet Sauvignon 2000
description: Intense ruby red color.  Aromas are typical of the varietal with the distinct varComplexity, richness, concentration and richness of the fruit.  A well-balanced, elegant wine.  Fresh and well-balanced, with soft and silky tannins.  A long, pleasant finish.   A versatile wine, well-suited for international dishes.   The great potential of this wine makes it a perfect accompaniment for grilled and roasted red meat dishes.

name: Terromaiu Charnon 2015
description: As the name suggests, this wine is all about the fruit. The nose opens with ripe pear, honey, and citrus notes and flavors with a hint of mineral and flint. On the palate, the mouthfeel is full, rich, and smooth, with flavors of ripe pear, peach, and creamy, ripe apple. The finish is long, crisp and fresh. The mouthfeel is medium bodied, with an attractive creamy mouthfeel that leads to a clean, refreshing acidity. It is delicious paired with a wide variety of foods, including shellfish, grilled fish, chicken, pork, veal, and pasta dishes.

name: Blynank Estate Merlot 2003
description: The aromas are spicy with vanilla, toast, and sweet fruit, with subtle oak. Flavors mirror aromas with rich plum and cherry flavors with soft tannins and toasty oak tones. The finish is long and soft with sweet, smooth, rich tannins. The mouth feel is full-bodied with well-integrated, well-balanced, ripe, rich tannins. The wine has a good balance between fruit, acidity, and alcohol. It is an easy-drinking, drinkable wine with good depth and complexity. Enjoy this wine now and over the next 3- 4 years. It will cellar well for 1- 2 years and will pair well with grilled and roasted poultry, roasted vegetables, pork tenderloin, roasted vegetables, and spicy Asian foods.

name: Tleym Rondergergan River Trands Red 2008
description: Inky, dark ruby-red with aromas of sweet ripe black fruit and floral tones. The palate is rich with sweet ripe fruit flavors and with a mineral edge. The wine is well-balanced, with good weight and a finish that lingers for a few minutes.

name: R'Arbiche Fraeker Natfl Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon 1999
description: Intense ruby red in color.  displaying ripe and spicy aromas with attractive blackberries, black cherries, and currants.  very well-balanced between tannin, acidity, and alcohol.  An excellent companion for grilled meats and game.  Excellent with roasted vegetables, particularly those vegetables that are lightly cooked in cream sauce.

name: Martia Bollovi Grenquancanti Pilot Gris 2003
description: Grenquancanti, meaning fire-bent, is the Italian name for a white wine. It is an elegant, well-crafted dry Rosé, full of intense aromas and flavors of raspberry, cherry, and mineral.   The wine has an intense color and a clean, dry finish.                                                                                                                                                lettuceheads

name: Ecrena Danos Pinot Noir 2008
description: The 2008 Danos Pinot Noir displays an intense ruby-red color with a violet hue. The nose offers a hint of raspberry, blueberry, and sweet violet aromas. On the palate, the wine is rich, fresh, with ripe fruit flavors and smooth tannins. This wine is well-balanced with a smooth, velvety mouthfeel.  The mouth feel is soft, round, and round with sweet, round, and smooth tannins. The finish is soft and refreshing with lingering mineral, blackberry and black cherry flavors.

name: Boguli Duntavillise Savettollar Muruzte 2015
description: This wine is a blend of Garnacha, Cariñena, Syrah, Tempranillo, Carignan, and Graciano.  The grapes are grown in the area of San Martin Bodegas, and are harvested on the last day of October.  The winery is located in the town of San Martin at an altitude of 1,400 feet.  The vineyards are in the area of the area of the famous Alavesa.

name: NeRenanc Mally Crigvaner Chardonnay 2000
description: Deep golden in color, with greenish highlights.  The nose offers ripe pear, apple, melon and mineral flavors, which evolve into mineral tones on the finish.  A wine of elegance, with a pleasant mouthfeel, nice acidity, medium body, and good length.  The nose offers ripe pear, apple, melon, and mineral flavors, which evolve into mineral tones on the finish.  The mouthfeel is full and balanced with pleasing mineral and tropical fruit flavors.  The acidity is pleasant, which gives the wine a refreshing, well-balanced structure.  The finish is long, fresh, fruity and slightly tannic, which is typical of this appellation.

name: Rosenrenaker Vertegos (hlaul-dol Bland 2016
description: This wine is a combination of Garnacha Blanca and Sauvignon Blanc grapes, grown in the Casablanca Valley.  This wine is a bright yellow-green color, with greenish tones, and the aromas are very expressive, fresh and fruity.  It has a fresh, fresh and fruity taste, balanced by a fruity acidity, which gives it good balance between the fruitiness and the sweetness.  The palate is fresh and fruity, with a touch of sweetness.  The finish is persistent, with good persistence.  The wine is fresh and fruity with great freshness and minerality.

name: Chateau 2ratheres Classere 7 Fiorce 2017
description: This wine will pair well with grilled vegetables, fish, chicken and roasted vegetables.  This wine will also pair well with roasted eggplant and mushrooms.  Serve at a temperature of about 64 degrees F and allow to warm in your glass for optimal drinkability.

name: Domaine du Toura Cours Chardonnay 2018
description: Intense straw yellow in color, this wine offers intense aromas of pineapple, mango, and peach, as well as a hint of citrus. On the palate, it is full-bodied, yet refreshing and with good acidity, with a long, pleasing finish.

name: Puzini Cabernet Sauvignon 30 Shilarca 2017
description: Bright, vivid ruby red with a slight hint of green. Aromas of red fruit and raspberry with hints of violet and vanilla. Elegant, balanced and pleasant on the palate, with balanced acidity and soft, round tannins.

name: Olfenake Estatuin Fum. Rosse (half-bottle) 1998
description: We recommend serving Fum. Rosse with grilled fish, particularly Northwest Salmon, particularly those fish caught from the Copper River in Alaska, poultry and milder cheeses.  Serve at about 57°F.

name: Tamber Calleris Reder Valley Cellars Minas Carnera Soignano 2016
description: The 2016 vintage of the Soignano Vineyard in Carneros has produced a wine with dark berry aromas with a hint of spice. The wine has a silky mouthfeel with flavors of fresh strawberries and cherries with a hint of vanilla. The wine is well-balanced and elegant, with sweet tannins and a lingering finish.

name: Bocaeda Ranto yoli-Albelto 2012
description: Aromas of ripe fruit such as cherry and blackcurrant with hints of violet. Well-balanced with ripe and sweet tannins. Full and long lasting. Pair with grilled and roasted red meat, duck and poultry... by Aida Estate Winemaker

name: Tourmes Geburu 2012
description: Noble tannins and a silky, juicy mouthfeel with an appealing and long finish. This wine is drinking beautifully now and will cellar well for up to five years.  wine Corp. Dave Matthews Estate Estate Pinot Noir 2012 [response] Bright ruby in color with violet tones, this wine offers aromas of red fruit, strawberries and cherries with undertones of vanilla, cedar and toast. The aromas of the 2012 vintage are unmistakable with aromas of red fruit, strawberries and cherries with slight oak overtones. The flavors mirror aromas with toasty oak, mineral, and roasted coffee tones. The mouthfeel is soft and round, with balanced acidity. The finish is well-balanced with well-integrated, round tannins. The wine is drinkable now and will cellar well for up to five years. This is a well-balanced wine that will continue to improve for the next two to three years.

name: Domaine Moint Restian Chasonan-1994
description: The Moint Restian Chardonnay is a wine that is classic for its complexity of flavors. It is one of the most elegant, complex, and approachable wines we produce. The nose is full of ripe fruit and spicy, floral aromas, and is filled with spices. The palate is filled with ripe fruit flavors with balanced acidity. The finish is long and pleasant, with good length and sweet tannins. It will drink well for its early release and cellar well for up to five years.

name: Losesseuit Hedien Merlot 1996
description: Intense aromas of cherry and cranberry with notes of mint, white pepper, and toast.  The flavors mirror aromas with Updated notes of blackberry, currant, and black cherry on the finish.  This wine is medium bodied and well balanced.  The texture is soft with supple tannins that will continue to soften over the next 3-4 years.

name: Almant Sauvignon Blanc 2003
description: The wine displays intense straw yellow color.  The nose presents notes of fresh herbs, grapefruit, and ripe melon.  The mouthfeel is full and round, with well-balanced acidity, sweetness, and good length.  The clean, crisp finish is pleasingly long.  The wine is an excellent companion to grilled fish, shellfish, grilled vegetables, pasta dishes with spicy or sweet sauces, and Mediterranean foods.

name: Jean Stua Spria Syrahmer Reserva Sauvignon Blanc 2011
description: This is a versatile wine that can be paired with a wide variety of dishes including seafood, grilled vegetables, vegetables and grilled poultry. Serve at a temperature of about 55°F.       with grilled or roasted meats and vegetables, roasted tomatoes, and rich cheese.

name: Gragia Sunwogy 445 Viutare Reserva Leonett Red 2003
description: Feeling guilty for enjoying this wine at the table over the past 5 years? You'll find your answer in this wine's name: Vibrant aromas of ripe fruits, strawberries and cherries with spicy overtones. It is a medium-bodied wine with great balance between fruit and oak. On the palate, it is smooth and round, with a touch of tannins on the finish.

name: Bouflers Dano Montadoi Zalloti Chianti 2013
origin: Chiant mistaken for a Montepulciano d'Abruzzo.
description: Bright ruby red with purplish reflections. Intense, well-balanced and complex aromas. On the palate, the wine is warm, well-balanced, with fresh and persistent tannins. It is very elegant, soft, fruity and well-balanced.

name: Bodega de Anesaro 2016
description: Intense ruby red with purple tones. Aromas of blackberries, Viper, black cherries, and vanilla, with hints of leather and chocolate. The mouthfeel is soft, round, and velvety with round and sweet tannins. Balanced, intense and full-bodied. This is an elegant and very well-balanced wine with a lingering aftertaste.

name: Venthbonture Kinongla 2001
description: The nose is attractive with white fruit aromas of pear and peach. The mouthfeel is smooth, well-balanced and full-flavored. The palate is soft and round with well-integrated acidity. The overall impression is of a well-rounded wine with good length and persistence.

name: Cattello Chardonnay Ranch Bliero 2016
description: The 2016 Chardonnay Ranch Bliero has aromas of tropical fruits, pear, banana and a hint of green apple. Flavors mirror aromas with flavors of pear, pineapple, citrus, and vanilla. The wine is rich and mouth filling with bright acidity and good mouthfeel. The finish is long with mineral and fruit flavors. The wine will cellar well for 2- 3 years.

name: Lagioda Barcoles Santa sug 2015
description: Bright ruby red color with violet tones. Aromas of raspberry, blackberry, blueberry and sweet spices. A full-bodied, well-balanced, and well-balanced wine. Good acidity, ripe tannins, and a smooth, long finish.

name: Telicama Barolo 1997
description: The aroma of the wine is intense and delicate, with spicy and fruity notes.  The taste is warm and full-bodied with velvety tannins and a long finish.  The finish is long and well-balanced.,  potential for ageing

name: Clos Naga Valley Casunta D. Mochoausella Cellargsio 2011
description: The 2011 vintage produced grapes that are of very high quality. Aromas of ripe fruit such as black cherries, blackberries and blackcurrants are enhanced by an aroma of chocolate. On the palate, the wine is well-balanced with fresh, good acidity and very pleasant tannins. The overall impression is a fresh, fresh, fruity and well-rounded wine.

name: Olnica Macilo Barovone 2005
description: The 2005 Barovone Macilo is ruby red in color with violet tints. The bouquet is intense and typical of the variety with fruit and floral tones, very characteristic of this variety. The taste is dry and well-balanced, with a pleasant aftertaste.

name: Zivagessockigna Serenro 2018
description: Serenro is a very versatile wine with flavors of pear, peach and grapefruit.  The wine has a hint of sweetness and is medium-bodied with a crisp acidity.  This wine pairs well with seafood, veal and poultry dishes with sauces that include a touch of saltiness, green olive tapenade, or goat cheese.

name: Duillan'sile ((50 ML) Rose 2016
description: Duillan’sile is a perfect match for fresh fish, especially those fish caught from the Taima river, and the Mediterranean climate of the Languedoc, especially in summer months.  of the Mediterranean coast of southern France. In addition, the wine can be paired with Mediterranean herbs, Mediterranean foods, grilled and lightly smoked fish. The wine is also a perfect partner for Mediterranean-style foods.

name: Jomain Parouleds Vineyard Chard-da Rose 2015
origin: Sta. Rita HillsFort Ross-Sesov Ridge, Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California
description: The 2015 vintage of Fort Ross-Seovo Ridge Chard-da Rosé is a beautiful wine with a beautiful bouquet of strawberries and cherries. On the palate, this wine is refreshing and refreshing with vibrant acidity. Flavors mirror aromas with flavors of fresh strawberries and cherries with hints of mineral notes. The finish is fresh, crisp and well-balanced.

name: Domaine Familol Crupagna Ridge Oncica Reserve 1992
description: A bright, deep ruby red color with purple hues.  Full, rich, complex, intense aromas of blackberries, cherries, raspberries, licorice, spices and vanilla.  Full-bodied, warm, velvety and well-balanced in the mouth with flavors of blackberries, cherries, leather, pepper and mineral undertones.  Firm, sweet tannins and long, smooth finish.  Pairings:   Perfect for a wide variety of dishes including pasta dishes, game and veal dishes with rich sauces, roast and grilled meats, and strong cheeses.

name: Casa Orduto Napa Robene Pinomarier 2016
description: Our 2016 Robene Pinomar’s aromas of red fruits and berries are fresh and vibrant. The palate is rich with flavors of raspberry, strawberry and cherry with a hint of spice. The mouth feel is medium-bodied with well-integrated tannins that give a smooth and silky finish. Enjoy this wine with your favorite food. This vintage of Robene is ready to drink now and will cellar well for up to two years. It is an easy drinking wine that is well-suited to grilled fish, poultry, and cheese plates.
